apple.name: Apple
apple.desc: Temperate tree crop that performs best with cold winters (chill hours) and well-drained soils. Varieties vary by chill requirement.
apple.temp_range: Cool temperate (5–20 °C); needs chill hours for many varieties
apple.soil_requirements: Well-drained loam, good organic matter, pH 6.0–7.0
tips: Provide adequate chill hours for chosen variety; choose rootstock for local conditions.
Prune annually to open canopy and improve light penetration.
Apply N in split doses; balance with P and K according to soil test.
Monitor for codling moth and scab; use integrated pest management.
apple.irrigation: Regular irrigation during fruit set and enlargement; avoid waterlogging.
apple.spacing: 3–5 m between trees (depends on rootstock & variety)
apple.harvest: Harvest when fruit color and firmness reach variety-specific maturity; store cool.

banana.name: Banana
banana.desc: Fast-growing tropical crop with high water and nutrient demand; responds strongly to potassium.
banana.soil_requirements: Deep, fertile, well-drained loam rich in organic matter; pH 5.5–7.0
tips: Apply high-K fertilizer during bunch development for better fruit quality.
Keep consistent soil moisture; mulch to conserve moisture and nutrients.
Remove diseased or dead pseudostems; manage suckers for production rhythm.
Protect bunches from strong winds; support heavy bunches if needed.
banana.irrigation: Frequent, even irrigation; do not let soil dry out during fruiting.
banana.harvest: Harvest when fingers fill out and turn slightly green-yellow depending on market.

blackgram.name: Blackgram
blackgram.desc: Short-duration legume (Vigna mungo) used for pulses; fixes nitrogen and suits warm climates.
blackgram.soil_requirements: Sandy loam to loam, well-drained; pH 6–7.5
tips: Use Rhizobium inoculant for better nitrogen fixation when recommended.
Plant at recommended spacing and avoid waterlogging during germination.
Harvest on time to avoid shattering and seed quality loss.
Rotate with cereals to improve soil health and reduce pests.
blackgram.irrigation: Light, infrequent irrigation; drought-tolerant varieties available.
blackgram.spacing: 25–30 cm between rows, 5–10 cm within row (varies by practice)
blackgram.harvest: Harvest when pods dry and seeds rattle; combine or hand-pick carefully.

chickpea.name: Chickpea
chickpea.desc: Cool-season pulse with moderate water needs; important rotation crop and source of protein.
chickpea.soil_requirements: Well-drained loam to clay loam; pH 6.0–8.0
tips: Use phosphorus at sowing for good root establishment.
Inoculate seed with proper Rhizobium strain if field is legume-naive.
Avoid waterlogging; use timely weed control early in crop.
Harvest when pods turn brown and seeds are firm to avoid shattering.
chickpea.irrigation: Usually rainfed; supplemental irrigation during pod filling can increase yield.
chickpea.spacing: 30–45 cm rows; plant density depends on variety
chickpea.harvest: Harvest when pods are mature and moisture is low; dry before storage.

coconut.name: Coconut
coconut.desc: Long-term tropical tree crop suited to coastal areas; requires well-drained soils and sunshine.
coconut.soil_requirements: Sandy loam with good drainage; tolerant of slightly saline soils; pH 5.5–7.5
tips: Maintain regular fertilization with NPK and micronutrients; palms are heavy feeders.
Ensure good drainage; avoid waterlogging around roots.
Manage rhinoceros beetle and other pests proactively.
Intercrop with short-duration species between palms in early years.
coconut.irrigation: Regular irrigation in dry months; copra and tender nut production benefits from moisture.
coconut.harvest: Harvest mature coconuts as per market (tender vs mature); process promptly for copra.

coffee.name: Coffee
coffee.desc: Shade-loving perennial grown in tropical highlands; quality depends on altitude and post-harvest handling.
coffee.soil_requirements: Loam to sandy loam, well-drained, slightly acidic (pH 5–6.5)
tips: Provide partial shade for best bean quality, especially for Arabica.
Apply balanced NPK and micronutrients based on leaf/soil tests.
Prune to maintain productive canopy and encourage new shoots.
Harvest selectively and process (dry/wet) promptly to retain quality.
coffee.irrigation: Supplemental irrigation during dry spells improves yield; avoid waterlogging.
coffee.harvest: Harvest ripe cherries by selective picking for best cup quality.

cotton.name: Cotton
cotton.desc: Fiber crop that prefers warm temperatures and well-drained soils; sensitive to waterlogging.
cotton.soil_requirements: Deep loam or sandy loam with good drainage; pH 5.5–7.5
tips: Ensure good seedbed preparation and timely sowing for uniform emergence.
Apply P at planting and split N applications during vegetative growth.
Use integrated pest management against bollworms and sucking pests.
Irrigate during flowering and boll development to maximize lint yield.
cotton.irrigation: Irrigate at critical stages (flowering, boll filling); avoid overwatering.
cotton.spacing: 70–90 cm between rows; plant density varies by practice
cotton.harvest: Harvest when bolls open and lint is dry; use mechanical or hand picking per scale.

grapes.name: Grapes
grapes.desc: Vine crop grown for table, raisin or wine grapes; requires good sunlight and drainage.
grapes.soil_requirements: Well-drained loam/sandy loam; good aeration; pH 6.0–7.5
tips: Train vines on trellis for sunlight and airflow to reduce disease.
Prune annually to manage yield and fruit quality.
Apply potassium during ripening to improve sugar accumulation.
Control powdery mildew and downy mildew through timely sprays.
grapes.irrigation: Drip irrigation is ideal; reduce water before harvest to concentrate sugars.
grapes.spacing: 2–3 m between vines (trellis spacing varies with system)
grapes.harvest: Harvest when sugar (Brix) and flavor meet target for intended use.

jute.name: Jute
jute.desc: Fiber crop grown in warm, humid regions on fertile alluvial soils; fast-growing.
jute.soil_requirements: Fertile alluvial loam with good moisture; pH 5.5–6.8
tips: Maintain fertile, moist soils and timely sowing for good fiber quality.
Apply nitrogen and phosphorus as per recommendations.
Harvest at the right time before over-maturity to retain fibre strength.
Avoid lodging by proper spacing and soil management.
jute.irrigation: Requires consistent moisture; avoid drought stress during growth.
jute.harvest: Pull up plants at proper maturity and rett for fiber extraction.

kidneybeans.name: Kidneybeans
kidneybeans.desc: Common bean (Phaseolus) crop used for pulses; prefers warm days and cool nights.
tips: Plant after soil warms; ensure even moisture during flowering and pod set.
Use disease-free seed and rotate crops to avoid root pathogens.
Control pests like pod borers with timely interventions.
Harvest when pods dry; avoid shattering.
kidneybeans.irrigation: Moderate irrigation; important during flowering and pod formation.
kidneybeans.harvest: Harvest when pods dry; thresh and dry seeds before storage.

lentil.name: Lentil
lentil.desc: Cool-season pulse with low water requirements; good for marginal soils and rotations.
lentil.soil_requirements: Well-drained loam, neutral to slightly alkaline pH 6–8
tips: Use phosphorus at sowing for root establishment.
Inoculate with appropriate Rhizobium if needed.
Control weeds early as lentil is a poor competitor initially.
Time harvest to avoid shattering and quality loss.
lentil.irrigation: Usually rainfed; minimal supplementary irrigation if available.
lentil.harvest: Harvest when pods dry and seeds are firm; avoid late rains.

maize.name: Maize
maize.desc: Versatile cereal grown for grain, fodder or silage; high nutrient demand, especially N.
maize.soil_requirements: Well-drained loam with good fertility; pH 5.5–7.5
tips: Use starter fertilizer at planting and side-dress nitrogen during rapid vegetative growth.
Plant at recommended spacing for targeted yield and mechanization.
Irrigate during tasseling and grain fill for best yields.
Rotate with legumes to improve soil nitrogen and break pest cycles.
maize.irrigation: Irrigate at critical stages: knee-high, tasseling, and grain fill.
maize.spacing: 60–90 cm between rows depending on system
maize.harvest: Harvest at physiological maturity; dry grain to safe moisture for storage.

mango.name: Mango
mango.desc: Tropical fruit tree that requires warm climate and deep, well-drained soils; sensitive to frost.
mango.soil_requirements: Deep loam with good drainage; pH 5.5–7.5
tips: Manage flowering through pruning and nutritional practices for uniform fruiting.
Apply balanced fertilizer and micronutrients annually based on soil tests.
Thin excess fruit when necessary to improve size and quality.
Protect young trees from wind and waterlogging.
mango.irrigation: Regular irrigation for young trees; reduce around harvest to avoid splitting.
mango.harvest: Harvest when fruit color and firmness reach market-specific maturity.

mothbeans.name: Mothbeans
mothbeans.desc: Drought-tolerant short-duration legume, suited to arid and semi-arid regions.
mothbeans.soil_requirements: Sandy loam, well-drained; tolerates poor soils
tips: Sow in well-prepared, moisture-conserving seedbeds for quick germination.
Use minimal fertilizer; benefit from Rhizobium inoculation in new fields.
Weed control is critical early in establishment.
Harvest promptly to avoid shattering in hot, dry conditions.
mothbeans.irrigation: Low irrigation requirement; rely mostly on residual soil moisture.
mothbeans.harvest: Harvest when pods mature and seeds are dry.

mungbean.name: Mungbean
mungbean.desc: Short-duration legume valued for green pods and dry seeds; fixes nitrogen and improves soil.
tips: Plant at recommended spacing for good pod set.
Use Rhizobium inoculant where appropriate.
Manage pests like pod borers with pheromone traps or targeted sprays.
Dry seeds well before storage to avoid aflatoxin issues.
mungbean.irrigation: Light irrigation; most varieties are short-duration and rainfed.
mungbean.harvest: Harvest when pods mature and dry; thresh carefully.

muskmelon.name: Muskmelon
muskmelon.desc: Vine crop producing aromatic melons; needs warm days, cooler nights and fertile soils.
muskmelon.soil_requirements: Sandy loam with good drainage and organic matter; pH 6–7
tips: Use raised beds and drip irrigation to keep fruits clean and reduce disease.
Ensure good pollination (bees) for fruit set; avoid insecticide use during bloom.
Apply potassium during fruit enlargement for better sweetness.
Harvest when fruit aroma and slip stage are reached.
muskmelon.irrigation: Regular but moderate irrigation; avoid excess moisture to prevent rot.
muskmelon.harvest: Harvest at full aroma and slip; handle gently to avoid bruising.

orange.name: Orange
orange.desc: Citrus tree that prefers subtropical climates and well-drained soils; sensitive to frost.
tips: Use drip irrigation and mulch to regulate soil moisture and reduce stress.
Apply balanced NPK and micronutrients (Zn, Mn) based on leaf tests.
Control citrus pests and diseases proactively (fruit fly, greening where present).
Thin fruits when necessary for quality and size.
orange.irrigation: Consistent irrigation using drip systems improves fruit quality.
orange.harvest: Harvest when fruit attains appropriate color, size and sugar-acid balance.

papaya.name: Papaya
papaya.desc: Fast-growing tropical fruit tree grown for early fruiting; requires warm climate and well-drained soil.
tips: Use disease-free planting material and protect young plants from wind.
Apply balanced NPK regularly; increase potassium during fruit development.
Maintain even soil moisture to avoid fruit cracking and drop.
Prune and remove diseased tissues promptly; manage pollination for fruit set.
papaya.irrigation: Regular watering; waterlogging harms roots—good drainage essential.
papaya.harvest: Harvest at half-ripe to ripe stage depending on market; handle gently.

pigeonpeas.name: Pigeonpeas
pigeonpeas.desc: Medium-duration legume used for pulses; tolerant of dry conditions and improves soil fertility.
pigeonpeas.soil_requirements: Well-drained loam to sandy loam; pH 5.5–7.5
tips: Use deep sowing when soil is dry to reach moisture; ensure good germination.
Minimal fertilizer needed; phosphorus helps early root growth.
Intercrop or rotate to improve soil fertility and reduce pests.
Harvest timely to avoid pod shattering and seed loss.
pigeonpeas.irrigation: Drought-tolerant but benefits from moisture during flowering and pod set.
pigeonpeas.harvest: Harvest when pods are mature and dry; thresh carefully.

pomegranate.name: Pomegranate
pomegranate.desc: Drought-tolerant fruit tree producing long-storing fruit; prefers warm dry climates for quality.
pomegranate.soil_requirements: Well-drained loam to sandy loam; pH 5.5–7.5
tips: Ensure good sunlight and reduced humidity to improve fruit color and quality.
Use drip irrigation; regulate watering to maintain fruit size and reduce cracking.
Apply balanced fertilizer with attention to potassium for fruit quality.
Prune to shape trees and improve air circulation.
pomegranate.irrigation: Moderate irrigation; avoid waterlogging; drip is recommended.
pomegranate.harvest: Harvest when skin color and internal arils reach maturity; avoid overripe fruit.

rice.name: Rice
rice.desc: Staple cereal that thrives in flooded or saturated soils in many production systems; high water need.
rice.soil_requirements: Clayey loam that retains water; pH 5.5–7.0
tips: Maintain standing water in transplanted systems during early growth stages as recommended.
Split nitrogen applications (basal + top-dressing) to reduce losses and improve uptake.
Use recommended varieties and good weed/pest control during establishment.
Manage water and drain appropriately before harvest for easier threshing.
rice.irrigation: High water requirement; flooded or saturated conditions in many systems.
rice.harvest: Harvest when grains reach physiological maturity; dry to safe moisture before storage.

watermelon.name: Watermelon
watermelon.desc: Vine crop producing large, fleshy melons; needs warm conditions, well-drained fertile soils and good pollination.
watermelon.soil_requirements: Sandy loam with good drainage and organic matter; pH 6–7
tips: Ensure adequate pollinator activity (bees) for uniform fruit set.
Use raised beds and plastic mulch in some systems to warm soil and reduce weeds.
Irrigate consistently; reduce water near harvest to improve sweetness.
Harvest when tendril near fruit dries and fruit sound indicates ripeness.
watermelon.irrigation: Regular irrigation during fruit enlargement; reduce before harvest for sugar concentration.
watermelon.spacing: 1.5–2.5 m between hills depending on cultivar
watermelon.harvest: Harvest at optimum sugar content and rind appearance; handle carefully.
